quote.text: If you are praised by others, be skeptical of yourself. For it is no easy feat to hold onto your inner harmony while collecting accolades.
quote.author: Epictetus
quote.aiInsight:
• Parenthood
    • Let the praise you receive for being a good parent remind you to remain humble, always questioning whether your actions truly honor the virtues you wish to pass on.
    • Focus on cultivating inner harmony in your family life, knowing that the true measure of success is not the accolades but the genuine growth and well-being of your children.
  • Leadership
    • As a leader, heed external praise with a grain of salt, reminding yourself that true leadership is measured by continuous self-improvement and steadfast adherence to your principles.
    • Embrace skepticism about compliments to guard against complacency; let this practice drive you to cultivate inner strength and a clear, unyielding vision that benefits all.
  • Product Management
    • In product management, external accolades should serve as one perspective among many; scrutinize your successes and failures alike to maintain balance and authenticity in your work.
    • Cultivate inner harmony by focusing on the process and the integrity of your decisions, ensuring that external recognition does not divert you from your core values and long-term goals.
